newsitem.title: USA: Barringer awarded contracts worth up to $16 mln.
newsitem.headline: Barringer awarded contracts worth up to $16 mln.

text.p: Barringer Technologies Inc said Friday it has received awards from the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration, a major European aviation authority it did not name and the Kuala Lumpur airport to install trace explosives detection systems in major airports.
These initial awards, said the company, are for 90 IONSCAN units and are valued at $6 million, of which $1.3 million was recognized in the first quarter of 1997.
Options to purchase an additional 200 units could bring the total value of these awards to about $16 million.

The initial award by the FAA, valued at $2.4 million, is part of a multi-year program to improve airport and passenger security by installing advanced technology explosives detection devices in U.S. airports.
Barringer said it was was the sole awardee both in Europe and Kuala Lumpur in competitive international procurements, which are valued at $3.4 million.
Barringer is principally engaged in the development, manufacture and marketing of high technology products for drugs and explosive detection.
